list_definition.definition: a small blood-sucking insect that lives in houses, especially beds

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Their hotel room was infested with bedbugs.

list_ex_of_english: He slept fitfully, constantly waking up to find bedbugs scurrying away after feeding on him.
Bedbugs have mouth parts that saw through the skin, and inject saliva with anticoagulants and painkillers.
Goods may cause problems beyond their value; for example, furniture may have not easily seen bedbugs, which may cause an infestation which is difficult and expensive to eradicate.
He was reluctant to sleep on the bed after discovering the bedbugs as he entered the room a little after midnight.

Insects and arachnids of medical importance for being hematophagous, at least in some species, include the sandfly, blackfly, tsetse fly, bedbug, assassin bug, mosquito, tick, louse, mite, midge, and flea.
Dried leaves are widely used as an arthropod repellent, such as a filling material for mattresses and pillows against fleas, lice and bedbugs.
The drug enters the human bloodstream and if the bedbugs bite during that time, the bedbug will die in a few days.
The hotel staff had used hydrogen cyanide against bedbugs and hadn't cleared the room as prescribed.
